metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12389 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox ESR 60.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.3 and Thunderbird < 60.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
